description: Ce projet a pour but de lutter contre la désertification et la pauvreté. Les produits issus de la plantation réduisent la malnutrition et génèrent de hauts revenus offrant à la population locale de nouvelles opportunités de développement.
name: Dosso

description: This afforestation and reforestation project is located in the Orinoco River basin of Colombia. The plantation is designed to provide long-term economic sustainability for the adjacent natural reserve, dedicated to the conservation of local flora & fauna. We use natural farming techniques to do so.
name: La Pedregoza

description: This project, situated on a 16 hectare parcel of land inside a natural reserve, involves the planting of a botanical garden in the Orinoco River basin to conserve its traditional medicinal trees and plants. The project is being done together with the Missouri Botanical Gardens in the USA.
name: Sacred Seeds Garden

description: Alamanga lutte contre la déforestation et préserve l'environnement grâce à une économie sociale et solidaire. Il s'attaque directement aux causes de la déforestation en gèrant durablement ses forêts et crée des revenus pour pérénniser l'implication des populations locales.
name: Alamanga

description: Lots of recent research indicates clearly that we need to conserve our vulnerable tropical forests if we are to have any hope of stopping complete and irreversible Climate Breakdown. Since 2007, this unique project has been working closely with ordinary Kenyan subsistence farmers to find ways to help them grow new food and timber crops that improve bio-diversity and reduce the stress on their threatened  and critically important tropical forest.
name: Bore

description: A community-based reforestation initiative that regroups small-scale farming families to develop ecosystem services for the voluntary carbon market. Participants reforest and maintain under-utilized portions of their land in exchange for payments for ecosystem services.
name: CommuniTree

description:
9% ? C’est le taux de boisement de la région des « Hauts-de-France ». Ce qui fait de nous  aujourd’hui, la région la moins boisée du pays. 
Pour remédier à cela : une seule solution : la plantation ! 
C’est dans ce cadre que l’association Canopée reforestation a vu le jour il y a 6 ans.
 Depuis sa création, ce n’est pas moins de 41 238 arbres et arbustes qui ont été plantés sur l’ensemble de la région avec la participation des habitants.
name: Les Hauts de France

description: We reforest degraded cattle pastures owned by Costa Ricans with diverse native trees, professionally managed for 25 years. We pay all tree planters a fair wage for their hourly work which empowers men and women in empoverished communities to stop deforestation. Our trees grow big and create new habitat, real forests and real jobs with social development and environmental education all ages.
name: Community Carbon Trees

description: Para recuperar los bosques autóctonos y poner el valor el patrimonio local se quiere regenerar la conectividad de la biodiversidad, las culturas del norte peninsular y la calidad del suelo, reforestando espacios naturales protegidos azotados por incendios forestales hace unos años.
name: Oso Pardo

description: Le projet « Planter pour la Planète » a été lancé par Madame Wangari Maathaï. Au Burkina, nous plantons dans la province du Sanguié en suivant les conseils de l’agroforesterie afin de faire reculer le désert.
name: Agroforestry to Stop the Desert

description: ArBolivia is a true partnership between smallholder farmers and social investors that provides a truly sustainable solution to deforestation in the Bolivian Amazon.    The project enables poor farmers to better manage their land whilst helping them to grow, harvest and sell native hardwood trees.  Not only does this result in reforestation, but it means the rainforest is protected from further encroachment.
name: Reforest the Bolivian Amazon

description: We are non profit organization dedicated to plant trees everywhere in Togo. We will like to plant at least 5000 plants before ending of this year. We want to focus  our actions on the north side because of the coming of desert from Burkina Faso. Our NGO is made up with 112 young peoples. We have started planting trees since 2008. We have a lot of experience and different tree planting format.
name: Terre des Jeunes

description:
Deep in the heart of the Peruvian Amazon the Camino Verde project is dedicated to protecting and understanding biodiversity in the Peruvian Amazon, protecting indigenous rights, autonomy, and wisdom, and spreading sustainable ways of life and encouraging fair, sustainable development. 
Our work lies at the intersection of people and forests. Our mission is to plant trees and encourage others to do the same.
name: Protect Amazonian Biodiversity

description: The aim of the campaign is to plant 20 million trees in and around Kenya’s highland forests, in order to restore the regulation of freshwater flows, help combat climate change, and protect forest habitats – while improving food security for some of Africa’s most vulnerable people. Around a quarter of the trees cultivated will be planted on surrounding farmland to provide food and resources, stabilise soils and increase crop yields.
name: 20 Million Trees for Kenya’s Forest

description: The Mount Kenya Trust plants trees around Africa's 2nd. highest mountain - Mount Kenya, surrounded by a vast, protected series of indigenous forests. We have planted almost 2.000.000  trees over 20 years and are seeking  now support for a new project to plant around 200.000 trees at Upper Imenti Forest which has been deforested and degraded over many years.  The area represents an ancient and important wet-season elephant habitat and refuge.
name: Mount Kenya Trust

description: The Project is implemented by a  community based organization  working to  enhance resilience of communities affected by  climate change in the Aberdare  Forest  Ecosystem. Our project aims to restore the degraded Aberdare forest due to illegal logging, charcoal burning, and encroachment. During the past years we have already planted over 500,000 indigenous trees. Project has  distributed improved cookstoves to 8.000 household + 300 biogas units.
name: Save the Aberdare Forest

description:
We provide specific initiatives to support in the rejuvenation of the Eburru Forest Reserve and its biodiversity (especially the Eastern Mountain Bongo), and the adjacent forest edge farming communities.

Eburru Rafiki are part of this forest edge wider community and play an important role as a member of the Eburru Community Forest Association (ECFA).
name: Eburru Rafiki

description: CAMGEW is working with Kilum-Ijim forest community to conserve their forest and improve their livelihoods. Adults and children learn by doing in forest regeneration with bee loving trees for honey production. We want to increase the number of such trees to increase flower production and honey for bee farmers. Once people own beehives and secure honey they will not burn the forest. It will be conserved for biodiversity and ecosystem services.
name: Kilum-Ijim forest

description: L'Escola Fluvià és una escola pública i està situada a Barcelona, al barri de Poblenou (Catalunya, Espanya). Vam nèixer fa 10 anys i volem transformar els espais exteriors de l'escola en zones verdes.
name: Escola Fluvià- Barcelona

description: Preserving Biodiversity in the Eastern Arc Mountains rain forest is the primary goal of this project. Additionally, key issues to be addressed are reversing the serious deforestation around Forest Nature Reserve, a critical need for woods and construction materials, the need for environmental conservation education, and extreme poverty alleviation through agroforestry.
name: Usambara Biodiversity Conservation

description: Seamos Bosques on Yungas eco region, also known as “Yungas Project”, has as it's main goal the enrichment of the local ecosystem, which has been depredated by human activity. The aim is to stop and reverse this degradation through the planting of native species, attracting native biodiversity to the region.
name: Bosques Yungas

description: C'est un projet de grand reboisement qui consiste à concentrer une grande campagne de reboisement  au nord du Togo pour réduire l’avancée du désert au Nord du Togo .  Une ceinture verte sera mise en place pour tracer la ligne de démarcation . Les membres de Terre des Jeunes Togo vont mobiliser et sensibiliser  les volontaires dans les villages où va passer la ceinture verte.  Ainsi qu'une partie du Sud Togo. 2017 l'année du lancement .
name: 5 Millions d'arbres pour mon Togo

description: This project is based in the Mufindi District of Iringa Region in the Southern Highlands of Tanzania. The targeted three villages are situated in the southern Udzungwa Mountains, part of the Eastern Arc range.  Efforts to protect, sustain and reconnect the forests resulted in the creation of the village forest reserves, and reverse the trend through active reforestation programmes.
name: Forest communities of Mufindi

description: To halt the decline of the Grauer’s gorilla in the Eastern DRC, Strong Roots  maintains a tree nursery that distributes and plants over 100,000 trees each year to villages alongside Kahuzi-Biega National Park. Due to high demand, Strong Roots plans to double tree production in 2017. Providing trees improves local livelihoods by providing organic fertilizers, firewood, and income for school fees etc., while also reducing pressure on the park.
name: Reforestation for Gorilla Conservation

description: PROBICOU (Pro-biodiversity Conservationists in Uganda) is working to save and restore Kafuga Forest, a pocket forest of Bwindi Impenetrable National Park in South Western Uganda. Earlier this year, there was a plan to cut the entire forest down and turn it into a tea plantation. This would have a devastating knock-on effect for the Bwindi Impenetrable Forest, home to an incredible biodiversity, including many rare birds and near-extinct mammals.
name: Saving Kafuga Forest

description: ASIREA promotes reforestation among farmers in the Caribbean zone of Costa Rica. Our goal is to plant 80,000 trees in 2017.
name: Agroforestry for farmers

description: El proyecto ARBA Sistema Litoral se dedica a la recuperación del bosque autóctono en las cordilleras litorales catalanas. Nuestro método se basa en las fases de sucesión forestal que se dan en cada ecosistema de forma natural. Realizamos siembras y hemos inventado un nuevo sistema de plantación: el laberinto
name: ARBA Sistema Litoral

description: The idea behind this project which was initiated by the sub delegate in the forestry and wildlife ministry was to provide forage for livestock during the dry season. He noticed that during this period, livestock farmers who depend on animals for protein and income, go to Bamenda to buy feed which is 60km away and the road is very bad. With the forage trees (about 5), villagers can provide cheap forage for animals especially during the dry season.
name: Anokwie Farming Group

description: Up in the cornfields of Pachaj in Cantel (10km out of Quetzaltenango), Armando has created an inspiring project to combat environmental degradation and stand up for indigenous rights. The Chico Mendes Reforestation Project (Proyecto de Reforestación Chico Mendes) is a community-run project that provides an awesome opportunity to work in solidarity in a rural village while living with a local family and learning about environmental issues.
name: Proyecto Chico Mendes

description: Trees for the Kenya is a nonprofit organization registered in Kenya and working with community members to restore degraded forest lands, plant trees on farms and schools. We work with communities living adjacent to natural forest to restore these forests through planting of indigenous trees species. Besides that, we work with communities to plant trees on their farms for fodder, nitrogen fixing, soil improvement, fruits, live fences, woodlots and
name: Trees for Kenya

description: The Tropical Andes Biodiversity Hotspot is the most diverse region on earth. This project's flagship species, the yellow tailed woolly monkey, is Critically Endangered and endemic to Northern Peru. High deforestation rates mean that if a radical change is not made there is a very real danger that this and many other species will become extinct. Impoverished local communities also suffer environmental problems and a scarcity of natural resources.
name: Save the Yellow-Tailed Woolly Monkey

description: The Mottanai Greening Project (MGP) is located in priority watersheds of the Aberdares and Mount Kenya water towers that the Green Belt Movement has been conserving for more than 30 years. These key mountainous ecosystems have been described as “the lifeline of the nation” given that they are the upper catchments of the main rivers that support Kenya’s key economic sectors, including energy, water, agriculture, livestock and tourism
name: The Mottanai Greening Project

description:
The Sierra Nevada is a forest region of vital importance in terms of conservation, but which is highly threatened by the adverse effects of climate change.
This project aims to reforest the zone by replanting varieties of trees suited to the environment and by developing economic alternatives to deforestation for local communities. The project places a particular focus on the introduction of the Noya Maya (Brossium alicastrum), an endemic variety
name: Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta

description: The project is intended to plant shed trees along the road from Kalere to Kajwenge trading center via Kanyughunya village. This  area of Kasese district is good arable land but which lacks enough trees for biodiversity.  It's a stretch of about 8km that we would like to afforest with 2 lines on each side of the road. The land to be  afforested is community land belonging to the Uganda National Roads Authority (UNRA).
name: RWICOD Afforestation Project

description: Mangrove restoration along Tudor Creek is an initiative by Brain Youth Group at the northern side of Mombasa island. The Creek hosts mangrove forests and other resources, attracting recreational activities such as yachting and boating, the creek is encroached by human settlements including hotels and residential buildings , leaving no protection zones. Thus, pollution from within and around the island is common leading to degradation of mangroves
name: Tudor Creek Mangrove Restoration

description:
Il s’agit d’un projet de plantation d’arbres essentiellement en association avec des cultures de café, sur des zones dégradée
(avec les principes de l’agroforesterie) afin de restaurer les écosystèmes, préserver la biodiversité, les ressources en eau, recréer des corridors et limiter la déforestation. Socialement le projet augmente les revenus des paysans : rentabilité, augmentation de la valeur des terres, diversification de la production...
name: Agroforesterie et café

description: En juillet 2015, 580 hectares de forêt ont été décimés non loin du bassin d’Arcachon, de part et d’autre de la D 1250. L’incendie a commencé à Cestas le 17 juillet et a brûlé 7 hectares de Pins d’une vingtaine d’années, et s’est poursuivi le 24 Juillet près des voix SNCF à Saint Jean d’Illac. La mission de notre plantation est de reboiser les parties brûlées en juillet 2015.
name: Saint Jean d'Illac

description: Somos alrededor de 10 a 15 Familias pertenecientes a la Costa Pacífica Colombiana (San Juan de la Costa en Tumaco - Nariño), nos dedicamos al cultivo del coco y la producción de aceite de coco 100% natural. Plantamos cocos a través de prácticas agro-ecológicas y de agro-forestería que promuevan e incentiven la sostenibilidad del territorio.
name: Tumacoco

description: The Grey Slender Loris (Loris lydekkerianus) is a small nocturnal arboreal primate only found in Sri Lanka and Southern India. In recent years, due to unchecked tree-felling, their habitat is shrinking. As a result, Grey loris population it’s decreasing. This project aims to create safe habitats for Grey Slender Lorises through the planting of native trees.
name: Trees for Slender Loris

description:
Konza Greens Community Tree planting Initiative is a community Based Organization with the mission to plant, grow and sustain local forest tree cover by engaging  school learners and  their communities in planting trees.  
Konza Greens   is focusing on creating awareness on  planting  of trees from the grassroots, through action based interventions on afforestation and planting of trees with school learners and their communities.
name: Konza Greens

description: The Viroqua Area Rotary Club is partnering with the Vernon County Land & Water Conservation Department to plant trees after the president of Rotary International challenged every Rotary club to "Make a Difference" by planting a tree for each of its members in the 2017-2018 year.  The club continues to grow & develop an ongoing project to prioritize the environment.  This is The Rotary Encouraging Environmental Sustainability (TREES) Project.
name: Viroqua Area Rotary TREES

description: The overall goal  of the project is to restore and conserve nature for chimps and communities  by revitalizing degraded lands in Greater Mahale Landscape of western Tanzania through planting  10millions trees of native, fruit and agroforestry species and Farmer managed Natural Regeneration by 2030. So far we have planted  more than 500,000 trees into villages land and wildlife corridor adjacent to Mahale Mountains National Park.
name: Trees for Chimps&Community Project

description: The project converts agricultural fields into agroforestry systems (combining agriculture with forestry on the same land), and reforests former agricultural fields not cultivated anymore. Our agroforestry + reforestation activities help to transform the current unsustainable agricultural practices, with many benefits for nature + local farmers: less use of pesticides + fertilizers, less erosion, more biodiversity, CO2 offset, more income / health
name: Agroforesterie et Boisement

description: The Black Jaguar Foundation pursues one clear objective: planting indigenous trees on a massive scale to help realize the Araguaia Biodiversity Corridor in order to improve the lives of each of us and of all future generations on our planet.
name: Araguaia Biodiversity Corridor

description: In response to the large-scale loss of mangroves and upland forests in Madagascar, Eden initiated the Madagascar Reforestation Project. The cooperation with Tree-Nation began in 2019 and since its inception, Eden has successfully planted over 10 million mangrove and dry deciduous trees with TN in northwest Madagascar.
name: Eden Projects

description: Keau‘ohana Native Forest Reserve in the Puna District of Hawai‘i Island is the largest and most intact lowland wet forest remaining below 1,000 feet in elevation in the State of Hawai’i. This forest is a unique reservoir of rare native biodiversity, and is also the most optimal remaining critical habitat for the endangered ha‘iwale.
name: Keau‘ohana Native Forest Reserve

description: The Yawanawa project is focused primarily on regenerating land, and generating food and a healthy economy for our villages. The trees planted with bring back healthy soils, and provide essential nutrition to the community. We intend to plant a mix of acai and other fruits trees that will provide us not only with more food to eat, but also an alternative to the man-made materials that we currently use to make our crafts.
name: Yawanawa Community

description: In Colon, Honduras, the Hernandez family manages 564.79 hectares of land.  They have successfully practice rewilding as a method of keeping 70% of the land a pristine humid tropical forest.  The focus now is to use regenerative agriculture methods: soil regeneration, permaculture and reforestation to expand the forest.  We welcome help to plant 55,000 plus trees in the next few years to help to offset carbon footprint and preserve the ecosystem.
name: Rafaeles Eden

description: The Adivasi Bhatra tribe relies on forests for food security and livelihood through the collection of forest produces. The project involves the planting of thousands of highly valued native trees in five villages, with the goal to help restore forests, enhance ecosystem services and rural economy.
name: Trees for Tribals

description: Our mission is to restore degraded tropical ecosystems, with our core projects being: Reforestation, Wildlife Conservation, and Education. We strive for an optimal balance between widespread and effective forest restoration – measured by the conservation of biodiversity, ecological health, and carbon sequestration – in conjunction with improving the economic and environmental quality of life for the local communities within our engaged region.
name: Conserve Natural Forests

description: Initiative supported by farmers who want to restore landscape, biodiversity and protect the soil against erosion through regenerative farming and reforestation within the natural zones on their farms. Located in the deep South East of the Iberian Peninsula (North Granada, Inland Almería and Murcia.)
name: Alvelal

description: Our project started in the foothills of the Pocono Mountains, minutes from the Delaware River. Previously a commercial farm and junk yard, we made it our mission to clean and restore our land as a safe and thriving home for native wildlife and the critters of our animal rescue as well. We felt so inspired taking on this endeavor that we have decided to expand. We are now restoring forests across the globe.
name: Habitat Recovery & Kindness

description: Bringing back the green of the Atlantic Forest (Mata Atlântica)! The Atlantic Forest in southeastern Brazil is one of the most endangered and biodiverse biomes in the world. Through environmental education programs, public policies, native tree seedling production and ecological restoration, Copaíba brings back the Atlantic forest!
name: Reforest the Mata Atlântica

description: Forest suppression and fragmentation cause the loss of many ecosystem services, such as water supply. To reverse these processes, we developed the “Sowing Water” project in eight municipalities in the Cantareira Supply System. The objectives are: to influence rural producers to adopt sustainable land use practices and to recompose the forest that has been suppressed; involve, through environmental education, the community in project actions.
name: Sowing Water

description:
This is an on-going project started in December,2019 with the aim of restoring the burnt Magila/Mkussu Nature Forest Reserve.
Please join our hands!
name: Replanting the burnt Magila Forest

description: The project is located in the Maharashtra state which is suffering from severe droughts in recent years due to seasonal water scarcity, limiting the access to potable water of the most marginalized communities in India. Short periods of heavy rainfall and absence of vegetation are major factors for soil erosion and land degradation. Trees protect against soil erosion and make the soil more permeable, thus improving groundwater availability.
name: Trees for Water

description:
We are building forests in the Wet Tropics of North Queensland, Australia. 
In particular we are connecting habitat and creating corridors for the endangered Southern Cassowary and Mahogany Glider.
With your help we can save these species.
Brettacorp Inc. has also built the first 9 Miyawaki Forests in Australia and we look forward to building many more with your support.
Since 2015 we have planted over 50 000 native trees across 35 acres.
name: One Tree Matters

description: This project focuses on regeneration in the fire affected subtropical forests of Australia. We will plant trees in the burnt national park where more than 4,900 hectares was burnt.
name: Fire Regeneration Australia

description: The year 2021 set a new record for deforestation in the Amazon basin. The Rondonia state is the main target for illegal Amazon logging. CES Rioterra is dedicated to the reforestation of these areas and developed this project together with Tree-Nation. Last planting seasons we planted over 70,000 trees and continue planting  now more than 30,000 trees, thus contributing to combating climate change, biodiversity loss and other environmental damage
name: Reforest the Amazon Basin

description: The Tiger project is being implemented on the fringes of Similipal National Park in the State of Odisha. Similipal National Park is home to the only known habitat of the elusive melanistic, or black, tigers. Similipal is one of India’s oldest tiger reserves. Declared in 1973 under Project Tiger, it contains 2,750 sq km of forest and is prime habitat for tigers, prey species and elephants.
name: Trees for Tigers

description: Les attaques de scolytes causent d'importants ravages sur les peuplements d'épicéas en France. Ce phénomène progresse dans toute France. Pour lutter contre l'expansion de cet insecte ravageur et maintenir la vie des forêts françaises, les propriétaires forestiers reboisent leurs parcelles. Le but étant de diversifier les peuplements et ainsi éviter la propagation de l'insecte.
name: Restauration Forêts dégradées

description: Since year 2000, the Bolivian AMAZON RAINFOREST has lost an area greater than Denmark to agriculture & cattle fields. It is tough to stop that, but we are successfully winning ground by continuously planting trees between fields that work as thick wind shields that have the capacity to stop erosion, bring back the forest and displaced wild life, restore humidity conditions and CO2 sequestration.
name: Amazon Windshields

description: Eden began its Nepal Reforestation Project in 2015 to help improve local livelihoods and restore forests in areas of critical importance. Eden has been working in 3 distinct regions across the country, including a partnership with Chitwan National Park, a World Heritage Site in Nepal. By partnering with the National Park system, Eden Projects is helping to protect and create a reforested buffer zone that is vital to protect animal habitat.
name: Eden Projects

description: Our work with communities experiencing extreme poverty in Eastern Indonesia provides consistent employment through mangrove reforestation. Locals to Biak Island rely on healthy mangroves to support fisheries + protect the coast vulnerable to extreme weather events (e.g. tropical storms). In 1996 a tsunami struck the island, destroying mangrove forests, homes + infrastructure. Tree-Nation adds to all trees the same CO2 of VCS certified projects.
name: Eden Projects

description: Daintree Life is planting trees in previously cleared areas in the Daintree Rainforest, in tropical north Queensland, Australia - the oldest rainforest on earth. Our aim is to plant 500,000 trees by 2030, to increase habitat and food resource for our iconic wildlife, such as Southern Cassowaries, Bennetts Tree-kangaroos, and a myriad of wildlife, replacing cleared weedy areas with rainforest. Since November 2018 we have planted over 11,000 trees.
name: Daintree Life Revegetation

description: In 2017, Chile was affected by the biggest fire in its history, that burned more than 600.000 hectares of forests, grasslands, plantations and hundred of homes. Santa Olga is a little village who was totally burned out and their people's work depend heavilly on the land. We've been working since 2017 in the ecological and social restoration through plantations of native trees with neighbors ands volunteers of diferent cities of Chile. The goal is
name: Ecological Restoration in Chile

description:
This an eco-social regeneration project to recover the Mediterranean diversity and restore a deeply degraded soil. Using sowing instead of planting, applying three eco-technologies: priming, pelleting and mycorrhizae.
The project also aims for an integrated regeneration of the local community, developing resilience, physical and mental health care of volunteers and the local population, especially the most vulnerable.
name: Recover the Mediterranean Diversity

description: The "Sierra del Caballón" is a mountain range at the heart of Valencia province. Is part of Natura2000 network (protected area for birds) and it hosts local endangered species. It was a forest with oaks, pine trees, junipers, ash trees and carob trees. It hosts also eagles, hawks, wild goats, lizards... but several forests fires in the last decades reduced their hability to restore itself. The last one in 2012 burnt more than 30.000 hectares.
name: Recovering the oak Valley

description: Pinuya Village is the smallest Huni Kuin indigenous land in the northern region of Acre. To date, the 70 plus families that reside in Pinuya have made enormous efforts and progress over many years to reforest their land as well as planting crops and trees to provide food over 200 people that live in the village. To avoid future crisis of food shortage we want to focus on planting food forests on the village land.
name: Aldeia Pinuya - Huni Kui

description: Jari Valley covers several productive activities – from forest management to sustainable agriculture and extractivism – being a region of great social and environmental importance, and constantly threatened by human activity. Since 2011 Jari Group's Amapá & Pará REDD+ Projects seek to promote sustainable forest management promoting the well-being of the communities and turning them into partners for the maintenance of the native forest resources
name: Amazonia VCS Conservation Project

description: The Madre De Dios Amazon REDD Project is located in the region that belongs to the Vilcabamba-Amboró Conservation Corridor in the Peruvian Amazon, one of the world biodiversity hotspots. The Project Area consists of two logging concessions with a combined area of 98,932 hectares. In the absence of the project these concessions are subject to frontier deforestation risk from new inter-oceanic Highway that unites Brazil with the Peruvian ports.
name: Madre de Dios Amazon REDD+ Project

description:
Asociación por la Recuperación de los Bosques Autóctonos del Bages.
Somos una ONG sin ánimo de lucro dispuesta a recuperar nuestros bosques y demás ecosistemas en la comarca del Bages, en el interior de Catalunya, y devolver a la naturaleza lo que una vez fue.
Ánimate a colaborar!
name: ARBA Bages

description: The Plant to Stop Poverty project uses an incorporated approach to advice and help  peasantry communities in rural areas to practice agroforestry as a way to fight against prevailing poverty and climate change effects. With this mode food and income securities are guaranteed while forests are restored and protected through tree planting. We have a previous experience of planting more than 140.000 trees in other projects in different districts.
name: Plant to Stop Poverty

description: The Schools Tree Project is non profit organisation that  tackles Climate Change through the planting of trees with young people in both Schools and Communities of Uganda.  We take the fight against Climate Change right  to schools in Uganda where we equip students with skills on how to tackle the latter through tree planting. We plant trees in schools and communities as a way of tackling Climate Change.
name: Schools Tree Project

description: arboRise in cooperation with the local NGO Guidre uses a mix of 40 local tree species as mixed plantations are more sustainable + proven to fix more CO2. Seeds are collected by local farmers. Valuing their forest assets promotes agroforestry practices. Seeds are coated with a natural mixture to protect them from insects until the rainy season, then seedballs are dispersed by direct sowing. Nature choses which will germinate (min. 500 trees x ha)
name: Community Forest Sowing

description: The mission of the USDA Forest Service is to sustain the health, diversity, and productivity of the Nation's 155 Forests and 20 Grasslands (area of 193 mill. acres) to meet the needs of present and future generations. The project supports the recovery from wildfires and spruce budworm infestation (with tree mortality up to 60-80% in some areas), re-establishes  the seed source for future regeneration and improves resilience to future infestation.
name: National Forest Recovery

description: This programme enables UK communities to plant native trees in their local public spaces. At just 13%,  the UK currently has one of the lowest rates of tree cover in Europe. Working across the UK, this project will increase tree cover, absorb carbon from the atmosphere, and provide vital habitat for local wildlife. It will also provide a vital community link - therefore encouraging both biodiversity and local communities to flourish once more.
name: Community Tree Planting

description: Due to the large-scale loss of mangroves, Eden initiated the program in 2018 to bring back the vitality of the forests that fringe the rivers + coastline. The project supports local communities to plant + manage mangrove forests, offers long-term employment + livelihood improvements to local  communities + protects biodiversity.  that relies on mangrove forests to survive. Tree-Nation adds to all trees the same CO2 of VCS certified projects
name: Eden Projects

description:
Redemption Against Poverty Organization-[RAPO] is a Non Government Organization and nonprofit organization dedicated to planting trees in  the whole region of Geita within the mainland of Tanzania country most urban and rural communities, where the need is the greatest . 




The aim of this project is to reduce poverty and conserve the environment among the community living in Geita region directly by diversifying income-gener
name: Geita Tree Plantation for Community

description: Wiatghana is an NGO established to advance develop in indigenous communities based on what people know and have. The Savannah Region of Ghana has suffered severe deforestation due to charcoal burning. We are establishing native tree nurseries in schools to produce over 10,000 seedlings per year per school in addition to teaching the students the value and traditional uses of the trees. Trees will be transplanted on indigenous lands.
name: Wiactghana native tree nurseries

description:
The International Small Group + Tree Planting Program is a community initiative dedicated to empowering small groups of 27,000 subsistence farmers to combat the devastating effects of
 deforestation, poverty and drought through a combination of sustainable development with carbon sequestration. Sales of VCS/CCB carbon credits generate participant income while the project today also addresses agriculture, HIV/AIDS, nutrition + fuel wood challenges
name: VCS Afforestation Program

description: FUTURO NATIVO, in partnership with the Kuntanawa Nation. The Kuntanawa 'Transform and Illuminate' project will mobilize and prepare communities to have quality of life and to resist the pressures experienced in the Amazon with climate change that is increasingly affecting the entire planet. It is a long-term project, with an initial stage of 10 years (until 2030).
name: Kuntanawa Nation

description:
Created in 2002  the project intends to be an important step towards forest sustainability and nature conservation, where the economic aspect, combined with the environmental component and social concern come together to help build a better environment, and a better world, for future generations.
We plant all around Portugal accordingly to the planting sites available. We work in coordination  with the Portuguese government to reforest Portugal.
name: Reforestation and Conservation

description: This Trees for the Future agroforestry project partners with local farmers in Senegal. With your funding the project's local technicians train 500 farmers on sustainable land management practices, develop tree nurseries, and plant 2,000 trees per farmer for a  total amount of 1,000,000 trees resulting in hundreds of sustainable forest gardens that will rejuvenate the region, along with creating food security and revenue for the farmers.
name: Forest Garden Program

description: This Trees for the Future (TREES) agroforestry project  in Western Cameroon addresses erosion, food insecurity and the unsustainable farming practices of smallholder cocoa farmers. Through the intercropping of multipurpose trees and fruit trees, this project is helping 500 cocoa farmers to grow higher quality cocoa while improving their land, and livelihoods.  We will plant 1 milllion trees (2.000 trees x farmer)
name: Cocoa Farmer Agroforestry

description: 4EverForest is on a mission to revitalize and reforest areas of the Cerrado that have been badly burned, degraged by farming or illegally deforested. The team works hand in hand with indigenous communities to promote economic growth & development of these regions with the Baru tree (Dipteryx alata) while building back natural ecosystems for local wildlife, and reversing the negative impacts of climate change.
name: 4EverForest

description: In the Colombian Andes in a region devastated by deforestation, we are reforesting with native, endemic and/or endangered tropical tree species. We also implement agroforestry systems with cocoa to guarantee the long-term sustainability of the reforestation initiative. Contributing to strategies that help endangered species from imminent extinction may be the most satisfying and meaningful thing you ever do.
name: Abarco

description: Our mission is to re-establish a sustainable, tree-based agricultural economy across the mountainous regions of southern Haiti. These trees reduce erosion and flooding, replenish the water tables, sequester carbon, and create a sheltered environment for cash crops. Driven by the community, locals restore their forests, local economy, and food sovereignty.
name: The Haiti Tree Project

description: Centuries of deforestation have brought Brazil’s Atlantic Rainforest to the tipping point. As temperatures rise, soils erode, species vanish, weather patterns become increasingly erratic and water supplies dry up, Iracambi works with local communities to restore the forest. Our goal is to plant a million trees to store carbon, protect soils and water, extend habitat and improve local livelihoods. Planting forests4water. Planting water for life.
name: Forests4Water Brazil

description:
The Atlantic Forest in Brazil is one of the most endangered and biodiverse biomes in the world. Through environmental education programs, and the creation of Miyawaki miniforests in public schools in Brazil together with local communities, this project will bring the urgency of ecosystem regeneration and climate change mitigation to the
new generations! Since 2018, we have already planted thousands trees and we plan to plant 7,000 more in 2022!
name: Mini-forests  in Public Schools São Paulo

description: The Angeles National Forest is located within an hour's drive for more than 20 million people who live in the Greater Los Angeles area, and provides a wealth of recreation opportunities. This project will re-establish mixed conifers lost to the 2020 Lake Fire. Some of the planting sites run along the Pacific Crest Trail and others are adjacent to California spotted owl habitat.
name: Wildfire Recovery in California

description:
The International Small Group + Tree Planting Program is a community initiative dedicated to empowering small groups of 96,000 subsistence farmers to combat the devastating effects of
 deforestation, poverty and drought through a combination of sustainable development with carbon sequestration. Sales of VCS/CCB carbon credits generate participant income while the project today also addresses agriculture, HIV/AIDS, nutrition + fuel wood challenges
name: VCS Subsistence Farmer Program
